overview.title: Overview
bullets: The Alligator indicator, created by Bill Williams, helps identify market trends and periods of consolidation.
It consists of three smoothed moving averages representing the Alligator’s Jaw, Teeth, and Lips.
It helps traders determine whether the market is trending or ranging.

items.title: Jaw (Blue Line)
items.desc: A 13-period smoothed moving average shifted by 8 periods, representing the long-term trend.

items.title: Teeth (Red Line)
items.desc: An 8-period smoothed moving average shifted by 5 periods, representing the medium-term trend.

items.title: Lips (Green Line)
items.desc: A 5-period smoothed moving average shifted by 3 periods, representing the short-term trend.

items.title: 1. Trend Identification
points: When all three lines align and move in the same direction, it indicates a strong trend.
When the lines intertwine, it suggests a ranging or consolidating market.

items.title: 2. Entry Signals
points: Buy when the Lips cross above the Teeth and Jaw in an uptrend.
Sell when the Lips cross below the Teeth and Jaw in a downtrend.

items.title: 3. Exit Signals
points: Exit long positions when the Lips cross below the Teeth.
Exit short positions when the Lips cross above the Teeth.

limitations.title: Limitations
bullets: Lag: Due to smoothing, signals can be late in fast-moving markets.
Best in trends: Performance degrades in ranging markets and may produce false signals.
